user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of body_compress:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
body_compress (void **buf,
               size_t *buf_size)
{
  Bytef *cbuf;
  uLongf cbuf_size;
  int ret;

  cbuf_size = compressBound ((uLong) * buf_size);
  cbuf = malloc (cbuf_size);
  if (NULL == cbuf)
    return MHD_NO;
  ret = compress (cbuf,
                  &cbuf_size,
                  (const Bytef *) *buf,
                  (uLong) * buf_size);
  if ((Z_OK != ret) ||
      (cbuf_size >= *buf_size))
  {
    /* compression failed */
    free (cbuf);
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  free (*buf);
  *buf = (void *) cbuf;
  *buf_size = (size_t) cbuf_size;
  return MHD_YES;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if ((Z_OK != ret) ||
    (cbuf_size >= *buf_size))
{
  /* compression failed */
  free (cbuf);
  return MHD_NO;
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No unreachable code in the shown fragment. The if-body (free(cbuf); return MHD_NO;) is reachable when either compress() returns a non-Z_OK code or the compressed size is not smaller than the original; the fall-through (free(*buf); ... return MHD_YES;) is reachable when compression succeeded and produced a smaller buffer. Therefore Rule 2.1 is not violated.
